body:
Comment 2: 
You're probably write that my wording isn't quite right. The confusion is between
"types", "typed constants" and untyped flavors of constants. With your clarifications,
it seems to me that the spec is consistent. 

Looking more closely, I see that the term "Integer constant" is sort of defined in the
"Integer literals" section:
"An integer literal is a sequence of digits representing an integer constant."

Perhaps I still don't fully understand, but Isn't this sort of backwards? An integer
literal is a sequence of digits as defined by the EBNF notation. An integer constant is
a constant value represented by an integer literal. 

I think the spec would be more clear with a sentence along the lines of "A constant
created with an integer literal is an untyped integer constant,  similarly a constant
created with a rune is an untyped rune constant, etc.". As it stands, the use of the
term "integer constant" is displaced from where it's used.
